headline: Investors in farm equipment maker Deere reject anti-DEI resolution
summary: Deere investors voted overwhelmingly against a resolution aimed at its diversity, equity and inclusion efforts on Wednesday, continuing a pattern of shareholder distaste for anti-DEI measures despite Republican political pressure on executives.  During a webcast of its annual meeting, executives with the farm equipment maker said only 1.3% of votes cast were in support of a resolution calling on the company to report on racial and gender hiring statistics "to prove it does not practice discrimination."  The resolution was filed by the National Legal and Policy Center, a conservative-leaning Washington think tank that has opposed many corporate diversity efforts.

headline: Deere lays off 119 workers at Iowa plant
summary: The tractor giant has struggled with waning sales and inventory challenges, resulting in a string of workforce reductions over the past year.
